Container.Name: ocrmypdf-auto
Container.Overview: [p]This container monitors an input file directory for PDF documents to process, and automatically invokes [a href='https://github.com/jbarlow83/OCRmyPDF'][code][strong]OCRmyPDF[/strong][/code][/a] on each file.[/p] [p]It uses [code]inotify[/code] to monitor the input directory efficiently, and is fairly configurable.[/p] [h4]Configuration Details[/h4] [p]See the descriptions of the unRAID volumes and environment variables for highlights of the configurability of [code]ocrmypdf-auto[/code], but for details including how to specify custom commandline parameters to [code]ocrmydf[/code] itself, or custom [code]tesseract[/code] configuration files, see the full README at [a href='https://github.com/cmccambridge/ocrmypdf-auto/blob/master/README.md']https://github.com/cmccambridge/ocrmypdf-auto/blob/master/README.md[/a][/p]
Container.Description: [h3]cmccambridge/ocrmypdf-auto[/h3] [p]This container monitors an input file directory for PDF documents to process, and automatically invokes [a href='https://github.com/jbarlow83/OCRmyPDF'][code][strong]OCRmyPDF[/strong][/code][/a] on each file.[/p] [p]It uses [code]inotify[/code] to monitor the input directory efficiently, and is fairly configurable.[/p] [h4]Configuration Details[/h4] [p]See the descriptions of the unRAID volumes and environment variables for highlights of the configurability of [code]ocrmypdf-auto[/code], but for details including how to specify custom commandline parameters to [code]ocrmydf[/code] itself, or custom [code]tesseract[/code] configuration files, see the full README at [a href='https://github.com/cmccambridge/ocrmypdf-auto/blob/master/README.md']https://github.com/cmccambridge/ocrmypdf-auto/blob/master/README.md[/a][/p]

Config.Name: Input Directory
Config.Description: Input directory from which to process files for OCR. <em>Container path: <code>/input</code></em>

Config.Name: Output Directory
Config.Description: Output directory to which post-OCR files will be written. <em>Container path: <code>/output</code></em>

Config.Name: Output Mode
Config.Description: Controls the output directory layout: <br /> <code>MIRROR_TREE</code> - (Default) Mirror the directory structure of the input directory, i.e. for an input file <code>/input/foo/bar.pdf</code> create an output file <code>/output/foo/bar.pdf</code>. <br /> <code>SINGLE_FOLDER</code> - Collect all output files in a single flat folder, i.e. for an input file <code>/input/foo/bar.pdf</code> create an output file <code>/output/bar.pdf</code>.

Config.Name: Action On Success
Config.Description: Controls the action (if any) to perform after successful OCR processing: <br /> <code>NOTHING</code> - (Default) Do nothing. Input files remain in place where they were found. <br /> <code>ARCHIVE_INPUT_FILES</code> - Archive input files by <strong>moving</strong> them <em>(overwriting existing files!)</em> to the <code>/archive</code> Volume <br /> <code>DELETE_INPUT_FILES</code> - Delete the input file after successful processing.

Config.Name: Archive Directory
Config.Description: Directory to use for archiving input files after successful processing, when running in <code>ARCHIVE_INPUT_FILES</code> <strong>Output Mode</strong>. <em>Container Path: <code>/archive</code></em>

Config.Name: Process Existing on Startup
Config.Description: Set to <code>1</code> to enable processing of any files in the input directory when the container is launched. <br/> Set to <code>0</code> (Default) or unset to ignore existing files until they are modified.

Config.Name: Verbosity
Config.Description: Control the verbosity of debug logging. Accepts python <code>logging</code> levels, e.g. <code>warn</code> (Default), <code>info</code>, <code>debug</code>, etc.

Config.Name: Temp Directory
Config.Description: Directory to use for all OCR temporary files, e.g. to select a ramdisk or a local cache. <em>Container Path: <code>/ocrtemp</code></em>

Config.Name: UID Override
Config.Description: Set the UID that the OCR tools will run as. unRAID standard is 99.

Config.Name: GID Override
Config.Description: Set the primary GID that the OCR tools will run with. unRAID standard is 100.
